title: Assessment of safety margin after microwave ablation of stage I NSCLC with three-dimensional reconstruction technique using CT imaging
patient: A 63-year-old woman's health examination revealed a neoplasm in the left lung, which was confirmed by biopsy pathology to be adenocarcinoma. This patient refused the surgery. Microwave ablation was performed with a power of 40 W and a time of 5 min. The patient was followed up at 4 months after the procedure, and enhancement in the ablation zone was found, which was considered recurrence. We reconstructed her pre- and postablation CT and found that the minimal margin of the ablation zone was less than 5 mm (Fig. ).
